title: Riot, you are so lazy with Tryndamere and it needs to STOP
body: There is no reason from a player's perspective that Tryndamere shouldn't undergo a full rework starting tomorrow. His kit and play-style has not stood the test of time, and unlike the Urgots of the world, he is still very relevant competitively in low elo and you can't just sweep him under the rug. Everyday he remains in his current state should be an embarrassment to you Riot and it's time to fix this vestige of a much older game.

replies.body:
>There is no reason from a player's perspective that Tryndamere shouldn't undergo a full rework starting tomorrow.

Because?
What players perspective?
Is he broken? Is he too strong, too weak, too orange, too swordy, too shouty, is his his left arm too weak, does his splash art scare the cat, is his right arm to Brobdingnaggian?

**WHY** should he be reworked?
**WHAT** should be reworked about him?
If you demand something from the people in charge, you should at least provide 2 things:
A reason, and a description WHAT you demand.

>His kit and play-style has not stood the test of time

What test exactly??
_"The test of time"_ by itself is just a meaningless filler-phrase some people think looks cool because they read it somewhere else before. Again, no argument provided.

>and unlike the Urgots of the world, he is still very relevant competitively in low elo

So, you want to convince the people in charge that change is required, by telling them that everything is fine?

http://memeshappen.com/media/created/-What-meme-12129.jpg

>Everyday he remains in his current state

WHAT CURRENT STATE?
You don't even say what his state is according to you!

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 

How is anyone supposed to try and see your point of view, when you not even mention what your point of view is?


Try again.
You put an interesting amount of effort into this reply

Out of respect, I will answer all of your arguments.

1.) By player's perspective I am referencing that it is my belief that Riot would rather spend time on reworks that make them more money.

2.) By test of time I mean that Riot would never drop a champion like that in today's game.

3.) By current state I mean his kit that has an extreme gap between learning curve/skill and impact on a game.

I apologize I forgot one.

4.) Being relevant does not mean that everything is fine. Hypothetically, if Riot uploaded a champion that automatically won you a game by picking it, it would be a relevant champion. However, gameplay would most certainly not be fine. Relevant and everything being fine is not the same.
I am bored and waiting for my coffee to be ready.
I agree that he is a poorly designed champ and at low elo he can get out of had but that applies to about 30 other champs as well so overall I don't think its a super high priority.
